title: Foundations of Number Sense
coursePhilosophy: This course treats mathematics as a whole structure where each building block is carefully designed and made.
longTermObjective: Students work one to two grade levels ahead through consistency rather than pressure.

formatDetails.smallGroupBenefit: Individualized pacing, close monitoring, and targeted feedback.

placementAndPacing.placementApproach: Students are placed at a level they can handle confidently (even if slightly below grade level) to ensure early success and reduce frustration.
placementAndPacing.accelerationApproach: Accelerate steadily and sustainably over time.

coreTrainingFocus: Addition and subtraction fluency (including regrouping and multi-step computation)
Early multiplication and division concepts (readiness for formal algorithms)
Place-value mastery (working with larger numbers)
Introduction to fractions (halves, thirds, fourths, and fractional thinking)
Multi-step word problems (reading, planning, execution across mixed skills)
accuracyThenSpeed: Speed is developed only after accuracy is established; precision is non-negotiable and efficiency is earned.

homework.notes: Daily practice supports steady progress and long-term retention.

assessment.individualizedSupplementalPractice: Assigned based on student performance and assessment results.

parentCommunication.purpose: Accountability and transparency throughout the course.

endOfCourseOutcomes: Solve multi-step arithmetic and word problems independently and accurately
Demonstrate strong mental math skills and number sense
Explain mathematical thinking clearly using appropriate vocabulary
Approach increasingly complex problems with confidence rather than avoidance
Transition smoothly into more advanced or accelerated math coursework

designedFor: Students willing to complete daily practice
Students who benefit from structure, accountability, and high academic expectations
notAppropriateFor: Students who struggle significantly with focus during instruction
Students unwilling to practice outside of class
studentFit.note: Instruction is academic and structured; behavior management is not a component of the program.

whatThisCourseDoesNotPromise: Guaranteed placement into gifted or specialty programs
Progress without consistent effort and practice
Accommodation for special educational needs beyond the scope of the course design
studentsWillLearn: Confidently work with larger numbers
Choose and explain strategies for adding & subtracting
Read word problems and decide which operation to use
idealFor: Kids who feel nervous about math tests

title: Accuracy, Reasoning & Problem Solving
coursePhilosophy: This course focuses on the accuracy of math answers with proper reasoning and grows the ability to solve problems.
longTermObjective: Students work one to two grade levels ahead through disciplined practice rather than pressure.

whyThisCurriculum: Strong emphasis on conceptual understanding and accuracy

formatDetails.smallGroupBenefit: Precise pacing, close monitoring, and individualized academic support.

placementAndPacing.placementApproach: Students may be placed slightly below grade level to ensure confidence, stability, and consistent success.
placementAndPacing.accelerationApproach: Reinforce foundations early so students can accelerate smoothly and sustainably.

coreTrainingFocus: Multi-digit multiplication and long division, including division with remainders
Fraction foundations and operations, including equivalent fractions, comparison, simplification, and computation
Decimal place value and decimal operations with emphasis on accuracy
Ratios, percentages, and introductory proportional reasoning for pre-algebra readiness
Multi-step word problems that require translating language into structured mathematical steps
accuracyThenSpeed: Speed is trained only after accuracy and understanding are secure; correctness and clarity come before efficiency.

homework.notes: Homework reinforces both accuracy and speed, with accuracy taking priority.

assessment.dailyInClassPractice: Immediate feedback through daily guided practice.
assessment.individualizedSupplementalPractice: Assigned individually based on assessment results and performance data.

parentCommunication.purpose: Ensures accountability, transparency, and consistent communication with families.

endOfCourseOutcomes: Solve complex multi-step arithmetic and word problems independently and accurately
Demonstrate strong understanding of fractions and mental math strategies
Explain mathematical reasoning clearly and confidently
Maintain focus and persistence when solving challenging problems
Transition confidently into higher-level or accelerated math coursework

designedFor: Students willing to complete daily practice
Students who thrive in structured, academically focused environments
notAppropriateFor: Students who struggle significantly with focus during instruction
Students unwilling to practice outside of class
studentFit.note: Instruction is academic and structured; behavior management is not part of the program.

whatThisCourseDoesNotPromise: Guaranteed placement into gifted or specialty programs
Progress without consistent effort and practice
Accommodation for special educational needs beyond the scope of the course design
studentsWillLearn: Multiply and divide multi-digit numbers accurately
Work confidently with fractions, decimals, ratios, and percentages
Translate complex word problems into clear mathematical steps
Explain reasoning and strategies with clarity and confidence
idealFor: Students with solid basics who are ready for deeper reasoning
Students preparing for pre-algebra style thinking
Learners who benefit from structure and accountability
